messages.title: Martin Tod’s NHS campaign: More ambulances improve response times
messages.content: Action taken by Liberal Democrat prospective MP Martin Tod has seen a big improvement in ambulance response times to emergency calls. Martin Tod uncovered the information after making Freedom of Information requests to every ambulance trust in England and Wales.

messages.title: Conservative plans threaten cuts to local secondary schools
messages.content: The Liberal Democrats will put more resources into all our local schools.

messages.title: Change that works for you
messages.content: Four steps to a fairer Britain: 1. Fairer taxes that put money back in your pocket 2. A £2.5 billion Fair Start for every child 3. A fair future: create jobs by making Britain greener 4. A fair deal for you from the politicians

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Improving ambulance response times and addressing shortfalls in NHS management.
Putting more resources into all local schools and opposition to Conservative cuts.
Fairer taxes, creating jobs by making Britain greener, and a fair deal from politicians.

issues.education: The Liberal Democrats will put more resources into all our local schools. 'Hundreds' of schools with large sixth-forms could suffer budget cuts under Tory plans.
issues.governance: Giving you the right to sack corrupt MPs.

housing.content: St Bede to get new classrooms: Good news for local families as the planning application has gone in so that St Bede's primary school can expand by two extra classes.

images.caption: Martin Tod with NHS Ambulance staff, highlighting his campaign for more ambulances.
Martin Tod with an individual at what appears to be a school or community center.
Dominic Hiscock, a Liberal Democrat city councillor, is shown smiling outside a school, in support of Martin Tod.
